intro: Elsholtzia cavaleriei, commonly known as Chinese germander, is a perennial herb native to China. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which includes many aromatic plants. The plant features square stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its small, tubular flowers are typically pink or purple and bloom in summer. It is often used in traditional Chinese medicine and as an ornamental plant due to its fragrant foliage.
